definition: to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces

pinyin: Mei3 guo2 Hai3 an4 Jing3 wei4 dui4

sentences.english: A C.O. fills a cup of coffee in the Guard Room.
sentences.chinese: 在警卫室内，一个狱警在倒咖啡。

sentences.english: A group of armed guards have arrived and are waiting outside the gate.
sentences.chinese: 一队武装警卫抵达并守卫在牢房区大门处。

sentences.english: He points over to the guard room as a carpet installation truck pulls up.
sentences.chinese: 他指向警卫室，一辆地毯铺装公司的货车开到了。

sentences.english: She crushed the bootee back into the basket and squeezed past the guardhouse.
sentences.chinese: 她把幼儿小毛线鞋放进篮子里面，挤过警卫室。

sentences.english: The men, who included four guards, were injured by rubber bullets and machetes.
sentences.chinese: 包括4名警卫在内的伤者因橡胶弹和大砍刀而受伤。

sentences.english: The guards often yelled at him and the other prisoners.
sentences.chinese: 警卫对他和其他囚犯厉声呵斥。

sentences.english: He landed with a guard of 500 men to sign the treaty.
sentences.chinese: 他偕同500人的警卫队一起登陆，签订条约。

sentences.english: This distinctive lacing is worn on military boots by paratroopers and ceremonial guard units.
sentences.chinese: 这一共同的系带是由戴伞兵和礼节警卫部队军事靴子。

sentences.english: Looking for an inconspicuous decoy to get you past the patrol?
sentences.chinese: 想找一种不起眼的诱饵帮你摆脱那些警卫么？

sentences.english: When he wakes up he finds that he is locked the handcuffs by the guard, Owen and electric edition disappear suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 贵仁醒来被警卫锁上手铐，欧文及电版不翼而飞。

sentences.english: The dig continues inside the guard room.
sentences.chinese: 在警卫室内，挖掘工作继续着。

sentences.english: The security members handled the situation in accord with the procedures.
sentences.chinese: 警卫部队根据程序处理了局势。

sentences.english: Now, the National Guard looks at us with respect and dignity.
sentences.chinese: 现在，国民警卫队也以尊重和庄严的目光看待我们。

sentences.english: A reporter tried to break in, but was checked by the guard.
sentences.chinese: 一名记者试图闯进去，但被门口警卫挡住了。

sentences.english: The safeguard personnel have the right to examine every vehicle entering or exiting.
sentences.chinese: 警卫人员有权检查所有进出厂的任何车辆。

sentences.english: He’d observed no guards, dogs, or alarm system.
sentences.chinese: 他注意到没有警卫，狗，或警报系统。

definition: to guard/to protect/bodyguard (for officials in ancient times)
secret service/special service/secret service agent/special agent
